humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, there are 5 lymph nodes examined, out of which 3 are positive for metastatic carcinoma (N1). Specifically, metastatic carcinoma is found in two of three sentinel lymph nodes and one additional lymph node. This information corresponds to Rule 9 and New Rule 12, resulting in an N1 stage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for this patient is N1 because there are metastatic carcinoma deposits in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes, with the largest deposit measuring 1.0 cm (pN1). This is based on the diagnosis section of the report, which states 'METASTATIC CARCINOMA IN TWO OF THREE LYMPH NODES (2/3). METASTATIC DEPOSIT MEASURES 0.3 CM; NO EXTRACAPSULAR INVASION IDENTIFIED' for the first sentinel lymph node and 'METASTATIC CARCINOMA IN ONE OF ONE NODE (1/1). METASTATIC DEPOSIT MEASURES 1.0 CM; NO EXTRACAPSULAR INVASION IDENTIFIED' for the second sentinel lymph node.
